alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:48AM EDT until March 26 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Barclay Messerly Road, McConnell East, and Knowlton Roads will be flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Friday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.6 feet this evening then continue to rise to 11.1 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday night. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 06/03/1947. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EDT.
